name: 3'-Nitrobenzanilide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4335
Reason: 3'-Nitrobenzanilide has a melting point that we can analyze by considering its structural components: (1) The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. (2) The nitro group introduces a strong withdrawing group, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50°C. (3) The aniline ring introduces two phenyl groups, which would add approximately +30°C each due to increasing molecular weight and rigidity. (4) The ketone group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, raising the melting point by approximately +20°C. (5) The methylene bridge introduces a rigid structure, contributing approximately +5°C.
